active.label: Enabled
active.comment: Enable or disable Buckaroo
active.tooltip: Setting this field to 'No' will disable ALL buckaroo payment methods. Users will no longer be able to use Buckaroo as a payment method.

limit_by_ip.label: Display Buckaroo payment methods only for selected IP's?
limit_by_ip.comment: This is useful to test Buckaroo before customers have a chance to use it.
limit_by_ip.tooltip: If set to yes, Buckaroo payment options will only display for users with an IP address listed in Configuration > Developer > Developer Client Restrictions.

key.label: Website key
key.tooltip: You can find your Buckaroo merchant key by logging into Buckaroo Payment Plaza and selecting 'profiel' -> 'Websites', then select your website; your merchant key will display at the top of the displayed form.

digital_signature.label: Digital signature
digital_signature.tooltip: You can find your Buckaroo merchant key by logging into Buckaroo Payment Plaza and selecting 'Configuratie' -> 'Secret key voor Digitale handtekening'.

mode.label: Mode
mode.comment: Beware that test orders will still appear in Buckaroo Plaza as regular orders

payment_description.label: Payment description
payment_description.comment: This description will appear with orders in Buckaroo Plaza

order_status_success.label: Order status 'success'
order_status_success.comment: Successful orders will have this status in the back-end.

order_status_failed.label: Order status 'failed'
order_status_failed.comment: Unsuccessful orders will have this status when viewed in the back-end.

order_status_pendingpayment.label: Order status 'pending payment'
order_status_pendingpayment.comment: Orders which are awaiting payment will have this status when viewed in the back-end.

success_redirect.label: Success redirect
success_redirect.tooltip: This is the page that users will be redirected to after they have successfully placed an order. Only change this value if you have a custom page for this that contains all the functionality of the default 'checkout/onepage/success' page.

failure_redirect.label: Failure redirect
failure_redirect.tooltip: This is the page that users will be redirected to after they have unsuccessfully placed an order. Only change this value if you have a custom page for this that contains all the functionality of the default 'checkout/' page.

manual_empty_cart.label: Should the module manually empty the shopping cart after a successful payment?
manual_empty_cart.comment: Some modules and Magento settings can cause the cart to stay filled after checkout. Setting this option to 'yes' will tell the module to manually empty the cart when an order has been places successfully.

certificate_name.label: Certificate name
certificate_name.comment: Enter a name for the certificate. This is purely administrative.

certificate_upload.label: Upload your Buckaroo private key certificate

certificate.label: Private key certificate
certificate.comment: Select which Buckaroo Private Key Certificate to use.

thumbprint.label: Thumbprint
thumbprint.comment: Please make sure the thumbprint matches the certificate you have selected.

order_status.label: New order status
order_status.comment: This status will be given to newly placed orders.

auto_invoice.label: Auto invoice
auto_invoice.comment: Whether successfully paid orders should be invoiced automatically.
auto_invoice.tooltip: Only turn this setting off if you wish to invoice all successful orders manually.

invoice_mail.label: Send an invoice mail?
invoice_mail.comment: Should an invoice email be sent automatically?

debug_email.label: Debug email
debug_email.comment: Beware that entering your email address here can quickly fill up your inbox. We recommend you only enter an email address here for a short period of time.
debug_email.tooltip: Enter your email address here to recieve debug e-mails containing details regarding the workflow of every order that has been placed and every order that recieves an update by Buckaroo.

debug_order_updates.label: Display order updates after order has been processed
debug_order_updates.comment: Display order updates after the order has received canceled, complete, success, holded or closed state.
debug_order_updates.tooltip: Orders which have been processed correctly often still recieve further updates from Buckaroo. This is to make sure that the original update has been processed correctly. Setting this option to 'yes' will allow these updates to be displayed in the back-end. This is useful for debugging purposes.

cancel_on_failed.label: Cancel on failed
cancel_on_failed.tooltip: This determines if failed orders should be automatically canceled. Canceled orders will no longer recieve updates regardless of any further actions taken. We recommend you leave this on 'Yes' at all times.

active.label: Enabled
active.comment: Enable or disable only this payment option.

mode.label: Modus
mode.comment: Beware that test orders will still appear in Buckaroo Plaza as regular orders. Setting this to 'Test' will also force 'Display only for certain IP-addresses' to 'yes'.

use_creditmanagement.label: Use creditmanagement
use_creditmanagement.comment: Using this will cause Buckaroo to send payment reminders to the customer if they do not pay on time.
use_creditmanagement.tooltip: Beware that this option should only be selected if your buckaroo subscription allows for it. Please contact your Buckaroo contact if you have any questions about this functionality.

limit_by_ip.label: Display this payment method only for selected IP's?
limit_by_ip.comment: This is useful to test Buckaroo before customers have a chance to use it.
limit_by_ip.tooltip: If set to yes, Buckaroo payment options will only display for users with an IP address listed in Configuration > Developer > Developer Client Restrictions.

title.label: Label
title.comment: This will determine the label of the payment method as it appears to customers.

allowspecific.label: Payment from Applicable Countries
allowspecific.tooltip: Select whether all countries may make use of this payment option, or only specific countries.

specificcountry.label: Payment from Specific Country
specificcountry.comment: Only available if 'Payment from applicable countries' is set to 'specific countries'.
specificcountry.tooltip: Define which countries are allowed to make use of this payment option.

order_status_success.label: Order status 'success'
order_status_success.comment: Successful orders will have this status in the back-end. Leave empty to use the status defined in Buckaroo 3 extended Config.
order_status_success.tooltip: This option does not affect the workflow.

order_status_failed.label: Order status 'failed'
order_status_failed.comment: Unsuccessful orders will have this status when viewed in the back-end. Leave empty to use the status defined in Buckaroo 3 extended Config.
order_status_failed.tooltip: This option does not affect the workflow.

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.comment: This determines the order in which payment options will appear to the customer.

allowed_currencies.label: Allowed currencies
allowed_currencies.comment: Select which currencies can be used with this payment method
allowed_currencies.tooltip: Your contract with Buckaroo must allow for the selected currencies to be used with this payment method.

due_date_invoice.label: Invoice Date (in days)
due_date_invoice.comment: Specify the amount of days before Buckaroo invoices the order and sends out the 'Overschrijving' mail.

due_date.label: Due Date (in days)
due_date.comment: Specify the number of days the customer has to complete their payment before the first reminder e-mail will be sent by Buckaroo.

due_date.comment: Specify the number of days the customer has to complete their payment before the first reminder e-mail will be sent by Buckaroo.

reminder_level.label: Max. Reminder Level
reminder_level.comment: Select the maximum reminder level buckaroo will use

active.label: Enabled
active.comment: Enable or disable refunding
active.tooltip: If you disable this option, you will not be able to perform online refunds on Buckaroo payment methods.

allow_push.label: Enable refunds from Payment Plaza
allow_push.comment: Enable to allow refunds you create in Payment Plaza to be processed in Magento as well.

order_status_partial_processing_success.label: Order status 'success' for 'processing' state for partial refunds ONLY
order_status_partial_processing_success.comment: This is only used for partial refunds
order_status_partial_processing_success.tooltip: This option does not affect the workflow.

order_status_partial_processing_failed.label: Order status 'failed' for 'processing' state for partial refunds ONLY
order_status_partial_processing_failed.comment: This is only used for partial refunds
order_status_partial_processing_failed.tooltip: This option does not affect the workflow.
